metadata.title: CVE-2018-14653 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The Gluster file system through versions 4.1.4 and 3.12 is vulnerable to aheap-based buffer overflow in the '__server_getspec' function via the'gf_getspec_req' RPC message. A remote authenticated attacker could exploitthis to cause a denial of service or other potential unspecified impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 3.13.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-common - 3.13.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-server - 3.13.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.2-1ubuntu1+esm1').
